website_summaries.verdict: Provides dual action with a high copper content and good compression. If copper therapy works for you, these are unbeatable.
pros: Boasts the highest copper content found in any arthritis glove
Works especially well for typing with good wrist coverage
Grippy palms ensure that smooth objects like glasses and jars don't slip out of your grasp
cons: The fingers are a bit short and a handful of owners note a reduction in elasticity over time

customer_reviews.title: Small rip in seam
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves in hope that they would help with my arthritis. I have been wearing them for a couple weeks now and I am sad to say the have a rip in the seem between the wrist and the thumb. I am hoping the Copper Compression Company sees this and can help me replace them. Other than the seam rip the gloves are very comfortable and are the perfect fit. UPDATE I received an email right from one of the company owners. He was very apologetic and took care of the problem right away. I recommend these gloves as I have been wearing them for almost two months and I feel a difference for sure. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: desiree gilbert

customer_reviews.title: swollen and painful hands. I also have Raynauds Symdrome and its ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m 30 and have fibro, and lately have been waking up with stiff, swollen and painful hands. I also have Raynauds Symdrome and its winter so that may play into this issue as well.. the gloves, when worn to bed, actually do prevent much of the pain the next morning. I was very surprised. These are also very comfortable, I got a different pair as a gift and those ones have a seam on the thumb that literally rubbed my thumb joint raw in one night! Took days to heal and I never wore those gloves again. These ones rock! Comfort, compression (gentle) and ride of pain.ill take it!
customer_reviews.author: Micaela G

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I received these gloves December 15, 2018 and could see that the quality was poor. The stitching on the middle finger of the left hand glove was coming unraveled. I sent an email to Copper Compression with a picture of the defect three days ago. I've had no response from Cooper Compression. Not Good!
customer_reviews.author: T. White

customer_reviews.title: Superb Relief
customer_reviews.text: Love the Copper compression gloves. I have severe osteoarthritis in my hands, and the gloves provide superb relief. I highly recommend them. Note: After reading some of the complaints about the gloves coming apart, it is quite obvious these are not "heavy work" gloves. I wear them while typing or folding clothes, etc. I tried wearing them at night, and my hands felt better when I woke up. I have hand washed them and air dried them. So far, they're holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Loved my Copper Compression Arthritis Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Loved my Copper Compression Arthritis Gloves. I work in an office where I am always on the computer and my wrists began hurting. I have tried gloves before but they did not help so I was skeptical to buy more but I am glad that I did. These gloves have really worked wonders with my wrists. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Danna Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and super small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the largest pair and it's not like my hands are gigantic. Large was too small to get on comfortably and the stitching is such poor quality they literally fell apart while I was trying to put them on. One of the worst things I bought on Amazon in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Todd O

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: My Mom has been suffering from hand pain due to arthritis. I am a Physical Therapist and have tried every treatment on her without success. In a moment of desperation, I searched Amazon. I found these gloves and gave them a try. Within one night, my Mom had a decrease in pain. She said," I can actually move my thumbs now." She has been wearing them for 4 nights now with continued improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THANK YOU COPPER COMPRESSIONS AND AMAZON FOR A GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best copper gloves on the market. I could barely use my right hand because of the swelling and pain caused by my Rheumotoid Arthritis and Sjogrens Syndrome. The swelling is down and the pain level has been reduced. Thank you Copper Compressions for a great product. PS: I have bought 4 pair of these along with the ankle sleeve and lumbar support.
customer_reviews.author: Life is living on the beach

customer_reviews.title: My mother enjoyed it because it helps so much on her arthritis
customer_reviews.text: My mother enjoyed it because it helps so much on her arthritis, the compression is just what she needs and it does the great job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gloves Worth Buying
customer_reviews.text: I have carpal tunnel issues and this is why I bought these gloves. They were recommended by my doctor because of the copper content. I do love this product. These gloves took about a week for me to notice the difference in my hands (wearing them versus not wearing them). The copper gloves not only compresses my aching hands but after wearing them for about an hour, I notice a tingling coolness under my skin. I wear them mostly when I am typing (for my day job) and I wear them when I crochet for pleasure. I have been wearing them for over two weeks now and they are worth mentioning to others who may have hand issues.
customer_reviews.author: Yoricha

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got them!
customer_reviews.text: My hands and wrists ache frequently, probably from too much keyboard use. My fingers also get stiff. So, I bought these gloves to see if they would help. They do! I have worn them several times at night and frequently when I'm on the computer. They seem to be of good quality. I would definitely follow the sizing provided to determine your size. I got the small and am so glad I did because the medium would have been way too big. In fact, if an extra small was offered, I would probably get them. You want a close enough fit to provide compression but not so tight that they restrict circulation. I'm pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Chris, Kansas City

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't give support and falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I bought this is because of customers review and the rating, it's not worth five star at all. I've only had for 2 weeks but it's already falling apart. I'm normally a large on gloves, I irdered a medium size so it'll be a little tight to give me a better support, but its not giving a full support as I expected it's loose, stitching on the sides are coming off, grip (rubber) on palms are coming off. If im ask if I'll recommend it to other consumer I would tell them no, find other brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: Lokelani Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Helping to heal
customer_reviews.text: My sisters fiance was recently involved in a motorcycle accident causing sever road rash on his hands. He plays sports and whenever he played he ended up hitting his healing hand (that were wrapped) with the ball or the ground when he fell, etc. He would instantly get big blisters when this happened. We got him there compression gloves and they are helping protect his hand allowing them the time they need to heal without slowing down his play time outside this summer. He is very happy. We measured his hands and got the size that was listed for his measurements and they fit very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Brittnerlynn

customer_reviews.title: Compression works great but the quality of the glove is cheap and ...
customer_reviews.text: Compression works great but the quality of the glove is cheap and does not stand up to my work. I have worn them for work for the last 3 weeks and the rubber grips have all worn off and the ends of the fingers are fraying. My joints don't burn as much so the gloves work but i need something that can hold up to 8 hours a day opening boxes and carrying cans of paint. They would probably be perfect if you use a computer all day or do lighter activity.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Lindow

customer_reviews.title: Great design, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I love the gloves, the fit, the support, the feel. However there is one serious problem, they are pourly sewn. The first pair I bought the seems started coming undone after about a week and the pair only lasted about 3 weeks. I liked them so much I bought another pair hoping it was just a problem with that pair. The second pair 2 seams opened up the first time I put them on. See photos. Too bad, a great design that is poorly made. I can't recommend and won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Keely

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these arthritus gloves one day and they have two holes of in them already!!! The return policy sucks so don't even try these! I am in great pain due to my arthritis in my hands and I thought these would help. Great way to treat a vet guys!
customer_reviews.author: Eloy Hernandez JR

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy!!  But Reconsidering
customer_reviews.text: These gloves appear to be well made, but after just a couple days, the right glove split in the seam. Not Happy!! Subsequent to my post, a company representative contacted me and made several offers to satisfy my concerns. One was a replacement glove, which I am happiy accepting. Stay tuned. I will write another review based on the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sistah Z

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This item was delivered today, as soon as I put them on they immediately ripped at the seam. I ordered the largest that are offered and they were just poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: abrantley

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would offer even minor relief to my ongoing thumb/wrist issues. I tried wearing it while typing, during sleep, under a brace...none of the trials made any noticeable difference. Even worse, when wearing for any lengthy amount of time (say over 2 hours) the seems left horrible and somewhat painful indents in my skin. And the material is far less "compression" than just tight but not very stretchy. It feels a lot more polyester than anything and leaves lots of black debris all over your skin. Overall, I wouldn't recommend to anyone and not super thrilled with the quality or makeup of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Angel871

customer_reviews.title: Gloves came already starting to unravel!
customer_reviews.text: While I love the gloves and feel like they would provide adequate relief, I am disappointed. The finger tip holes came already starting to unravel somewhat. I am concerned about the durability and longevity of the gloves. For that reason, I gave it a 1.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Great compression gloves!
customer_reviews.text: these are great for pain from overuse of my hand. I am an artist so my right hand stays sore a lot. I like these because they go around my bottom knuckles where my fingers attach to the palm of my hand where I get really sore as well as my wrist. I actually use a wrist stabilizer on top of these. They ONLY issue I have with them is that they can be a bit irritating to my skin at times. I guess it's the high copper content. I'm not sure about the validity of claims that copper helps any more than regular compression gloves but these help overall so I guess that is what counts! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Serina R.

customer_reviews.title: Bad craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I got these in the mail today and was super excited to try them out at work . I suffer from RA and work as a bank teller so my hands are always in pain. After 3 hrs at work ( not even a busy day) the threads on the fingers started to unravel . Sorry i wanted these so bad but the poor craftsmanship has me sending them right back for a return . I also purchased the knee sleeve too but have yet to try it out .
customer_reviews.author: samuel

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, unsure of benefit
customer_reviews.text: The seam on the left glove split after a week. Disappointed in the quality. Did not feel any benefit after a week of use. Per their website, 100% guarantee policy is only for 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Woosch

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: I was intrigued about these gloves because of all the good reviews and the reasonable price. Unfortunately these gloves are almost paper thin and started coming apart the first time I wore them. They were made as cheaply as possible and are not robust at all. Very difficult to get off without damaging them. I like that they are as unobtrusive as possible because they are thin, but I don't like how cheap they feel and look (because of how thin and delicate they are). I wish They had an option that was twice as expensive and actually felt like a high quality glove with better stitching between parts. I'm bummed out! Was looking forward to these.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: These are doll's gloves! I followed the size chart ...
customer_reviews.text: These are doll's gloves! I followed the size chart carefully, and ordered a size up. I am a woman with medium-small hands...I couldn't even get them up to my knuckles. Beware! Doll sizes! I am so angry that I just threw them away.
customer_reviews.author: COLLEEN A LYTLE

customer_reviews.title: Compression good, quality bad!
customer_reviews.text: I have very bad arthritis in my hands and was looking forward to some relief. I wore them yesterday and the compression was good and helped with the pain. However the quality of the gloves, especially the grip strips, is really poor. They are already coming off after the first day of wear! I will continue to use these as I think they helped overall, but there has to be a better quality of material to make these with.
customer_reviews.author: K. Van Valkenburg

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered these in April. By July, I had to contact the company because they were falling apart without much use. They were great and sent out a replacement pair. It's now September and the replacement is falling apart now too. Again, they're not worn all the time. Highly disappointed and annoyed I wasted money on these. Save your money and maybe look for another brand. UPDATE: Their customer service is probably the best I've encountered in a long time. If you're unhappy for any reason, they will work with you until you're happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: an ace bandage would work better
customer_reviews.text: The cut off fingers were unraveling even before I put them on. There is no compression. I have small hands and they do not offer an extra small. And this copper thing being pushed down our throats and it's a hoax going back decades.
customer_reviews.author: lorin

customer_reviews.title: I wouldnt know if the copper infusion in these gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: I wouldnt know if the copper infusion in these gloves helped in any way. The gloves split at the seams when I put them on for the third time. Cotton knit compression gloves from pharmacy worked well, but they were warm. I thought non-cotton gloves would be cooler and these were be cooler, but the synthetic fabric offered no compression. And the seams split...so....worthless.
customer_reviews.author: T. P.

customer_reviews.title: SO COMFORTABLE I FELL ASLEEP WITH THEM ON.
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY LOVE THESE GLOVES, THEY FIT SO GREAT,THEY ARE SNUG BUT NOT TO TIGHT TO WERE THEY ARE CUTTING OF YOUR CIRCULATION. I GOT THE LARGE , MY HAND MEASURES ACROSS MY HAND JUST BELOW MY KNUCKLES 3 1/4 INCHES . THEY ARE SO COMFORTABLE I FELL ASLEEP WITH THEM ON . I WOULD REALLY RECOMMEND THESE TO ANYONE THAT HAS PAIN OR SWELLING IN THERE HANDS.
customer_reviews.author: ajax

customer_reviews.title: Ripped seams within 24 hours, BOTH gloves
customer_reviews.text: The gloves felt great for the first 24 hours. After wearing them on and off the first day, the seams around the fingers began to fray and the side seam on BOTH gloves ripped. They are practically unusable now since the ripped seams greatly reduce the compression. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CasperQ

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not great
customer_reviews.text: Useful, but the rubber strips lining the palms started peeling off after a month after just using a keyboard and game controller daily. Also, the finger holes aren't folded back and stitched, so the cut fabric is exposed and also fraying/unraveling. They do work for me, but I don't expect them to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS A. PIASCIK

customer_reviews.title: Rub Ribbed Webbing Failure
customer_reviews.text: The Copper Compression Arthritis Gloves are for the most part excellent products. However, whomever made the decision to forgo QA/QC with the production failed. Within a very short period of usage, the external rubberized grip ribbed began to brake off under non-abrasive environments .Just using in normal use, the product started to fail. The bonding to fabric is the issue. Poor quality controls.
customer_reviews.author: Shiba Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Decent Compression Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are lightweight but provide a fair amount of compression without limiting hand and finger mobility. The only reason I am giving four instead of five stars is because the stitching on part of the side seam was sub-par, and it opened up on both gloves after a couple of days. I sewed them back up by hand using a lockstitch, and they have been fine since. In the 90+ degree and sweltering days we have had recently, I had expected some sweating hands due to the tight weave of the gloves, but I was pleasantly surprised that they stayed dry. So far, I am happy with the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Rat Wrangler

customer_reviews.title: Did not help just made it worse
customer_reviews.text: I have pain in my hands that shoots up my elbow when at rest, my fingers get pins and needles numb throughout the day and at night. I tried this gloves and oh the horror: after a few minutes a felt as if my circulation was cut to my entire hand, it became numb, the entire hand! I quickly took it off. The glove was the correct size, not too small. It just does not work for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: By the end of the first day of wear, the rubber non-slip strips on the palm are falling off. I am an active 67 year old and that is part of the reason I have arthritis in my hands. I am not going to just sit around and listen to my arteries harden so any gloves I wear have to be durable...these are *not*. Also, the fingers look like someone just took a pair of scissors and trimmed the ends off leaving an unfinished edge with strings hanging out.
customer_reviews.author: Jack E. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Purchased them twice
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves for about the first 6 months to a year. They help me avoid wrist fatigue when I'm working at my desk job or playing video games for a long time. They don't make my hands sweat or get overly warm, which is a nice benefit. The only downside is that they stretch out to the point where they don't help as much as I'd like, so then I end up having to buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: They’re ok!
customer_reviews.text: These did the job ish kinda ish but am Only worried about how they started peeling within a couple weeks of wear. So I hope the “copper” or whatever it is that compresses doesn’t wear off because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: NMB8788

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have Lupus and Fibromyalgia. My hands swell and hurt often. I read a review about someone wearing them to bed and waking with improved hands. First night I had them, I wore them. Very comfortable. While I rested, I felt a slight tingling and warmth in my hands run right along the areas that hurt most. In the morning, my hands felt great! No swollen fingers, no pain. I was actually able to take my wedding ring off for the first time in over a month! If you or you know of someone with Lupus or Fibromyalgia, these are definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Quast

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTWEIGHT AND COMFORTABLE COPPER GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: I really like these copper compression gloves! Recently I had and attack of tendonitis and carpal tunnel at the same time - which was really fun! After wearing out my other copper gloves I ordered these. They are very lightweight. I've worn them during the summer months and they didn't make my hand sweat as much as some of the other copper gloves. At the same time they are very snug around the fingers and wrist and help me when I'm typing or using my hand a lot. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Game changer as I work with my hands!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a jewelry maker and use my hands all the time. While pregnant I have experienced bad arthritis in my hands and couldn’t get through making a piece without icing my hands. No joke, just started using these gloves and did 9 pieces today easily. I have barely any soreness after! Crazy! Yesterday I did six pieces of jewelry and my hands felt like I’d done nothing w my hands. The compression is good, not too tight, true to size, not to thick or bulky but pretty slim yet sturdy fabric. No slip gripping on the palms which I appreciate. And effortless mobility. 10/10 will buy these again and recommend to anyone! Very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: T. K.

customer_reviews.title: Just a glove...
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like the material, unlike some other reviewers. But I got absolutely no relief while wearing these. Possibly because the glove was too big? I am returning the Medium and purchasing the Small. Giving it another shot...
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Tommie Copper & Prolotex compression gloves for several years. They are both wonderful. I ordered the Copper Compression gloves in size large for those times when my hands are extra swollen and painful and I find my others too tight. Sadly, the wrist cuff on these gloves is so small and not very stretchy. I wore them for a short amount of time last night and they cut off the circulation around my wrists. This was not a prime deal of any value. These gloves are going back on Monday. Don’t waste your money. Spend a little more and get the real thing. Disappointed, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good for doing yoga with weak wrists.
customer_reviews.text: I don't believe in the myth about copper alleviating arthritis symptoms but I wanted some gloves to wear when doing yoga poses that require one to put most of one's weight on one's hands. I have strained my writs doing this in the past. I was using wrist braces but was doing yoga on carpet which would grab the velcro on the braces and tear them off. These work quite well for my purposes. They are thinner than they look in the picture but they have still be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Iffy workmanship
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves for less than 24 hours. My hand (I fell and broke my hand back in January) feels better when I wear them when I take my brace off, but they have already separated at the seam on the cuff, and, it is obvious that they simply took the long-fingered version of these gloves and cut the fingers down. To their credit, they did overstitch the tops of the shortened fingers, but not the bottoms where the ribbing is. In short, I suspect that I will be having to return these, if only for the town cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Dove

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: I don't see much difference between these and the non-copper gloves I have. 3 stars because they DO work, I just don't know if the copper infusion does much. I bought the smallest size I could (I have small hands) and they are still too big. They don't fit well on my wrists at all, and do not feel snug on my hand. My fingers do feel snug, but nothing else. I do like the grips, especially for driving or holding my mug, etc...and it doesn't interfere with my yarn when I crochet. So overall, ok but not great mostly due to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica K.

customer_reviews.title: Gloves are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I finally have some relief from rheumatoid arthritis in my left hand and that's thanks to this glove. I don't understand why doctors don't recommend something like this since there is no cure but what we want is relief from pain. I am so glad I found this and have finally found relief from pain without pills and most importantly I can type for hours without having to lose money because I need a break. My job requires I type and taking breaks because of the pain is hurting the budget. I can afford to purchase these gloves since they are not expensive and also earn what I need making a living. thanks for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: vblady3

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves. Not life-saving, but surgery preventing for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I have tendinitis from playing guitar and my career in IT. So this was a shot in the dark, but I was wanting anything to work. These gloves aren’t too bad of a fashion, and also help so much! The compression is perfect for my ailment. Not too tight, but yet holds the hand in place and relieves any pain. Recommended for anyone with beginning stages of tendinitis or carpal tunnel. It may even prevent the two from escalating into surgery. Honest!
customer_reviews.author: Demonic Doug

customer_reviews.title: No real compression, even with a small size
customer_reviews.text: There’s little to no compression in these gloves. At first, I thought it was because I purchased a size medium by a mistake. But, I returned it for a small and still not compressing enough to do anything for the pain and swelling in my hands. I am returning them this week.
customer_reviews.author: I. S. Banks

customer_reviews.title: WOW!! They work!!
customer_reviews.text: I am 70 years old, in good health but have arthritis issues. Decided to try the Copper Compression gloves -- what did I have to lose? Received them yesterday and I wore them to bed last night. I woke to NO pain and NO tingling in my hands. My, Oh My!!! Looking forward to continued relief.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: A hole will surely affect compression...
customer_reviews.text: Despite reviews stating that these gloves were poorly made, I took a risk and went with the reviews stating that people were pleased. I received my gloves today and I was pleased...until I noticed a hole. It is hidden until i bend my thumb. There isn’t any thread in the area where the hole is. For the price, I am now agreeing with others that this is unacceptable for this product. I will certainly be looking to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: Quenise Beckford

customer_reviews.title: Was not Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This Copper compression Arthritis gloves were not easy to put on and get in the right place on your hand. You had to take if off several times before you got it right. When you washed your hands it was hard to keep from getting them wet. I became sick and had to take treatments for six months and still taking treatments for health issues, so this was not on my mind at the time. I love Amazon since I have spent several thousand dollars in the last few years. I request a refund or a credit on this item. Please e-mail your response. Thank you in advance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Updated
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how or why they work they just do and I am soooooo happy to not use those clunky wrist guards the doctor gave me, they did nothing but making me stiff but these omg I till be buying extras just to have them everywhere! Update: changing review from 5 to 2 stars they started bursting at the seams not even a week after wearing. Will update again depending on companies handling of this issue Another update with change to 1 star, Amazon sent out a replacement pair but the state of the gloves after wearing them for 2 weeks is depressing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What is "compression" supposed to feel like?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in a size "small". They still fit more like any other glove, but are actually a little loose. With "compression", I was expecting them to be a little "snug" or something, but they are not. I almost suspected that they were used and returned with how loose they felt from the first time I wore them. They are the most loose in the fingers, where I need the relief the most.
customer_reviews.author: Catnip

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: They are okay for a day or two but then they start to fall apart. I don't think I'm being too rough on them or anything, just the threads keep pulling out. I haven't even tried to wash them yet and probably won't or I might regret it.
customer_reviews.author: CBar

customer_reviews.title: Sizing perhaps not right?
customer_reviews.text: Just received these in the mail and was really looking forward to seeing what relief they might offer my achy fingers/hands. When I put them on, though, they don't seem to have much of a compression effect... I ordered medium, per the measurement guide, but I think I may actually need small... When I went back to check the size guide on the product page, it was as I remembered it, so I'm not sure... Interestingly, though, the full finger version size guide (different than the one for the half finger gloves) indicates that my hand measurement would indeed be a small. So I'm thinking I'll probably return these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wow I was a bit skeptical but they actually work! I have tendinitis in my thumbs and arthritis in my finger joints and my hands hurt all the time. I actually slept through the night without having them wake me up to crack something. The only downfall I’m a very active person always cleaning, cooking and doing yard work so It would probably be wise to get rubber gloves and yard gloves to go over them. Other than that I absolutely love them and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: maria berrios

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are horrible👎
customer_reviews.text: The advertising is very misleading, the gloves were very cheaply made, the cheesy grip pattern started to come off only after 2 hours of wear as well as the stitching started to fringe and the gloves cut off way above my knuckles. I have never done a review on any of my purchases because I have been pleasantly satisfied with each and every purchase i have made over the last 15years, but I felt compelled to do this review because I was so highly disappointed in these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M Barber

customer_reviews.title: Wow! I’m a believer.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it is the compression or the copper but I’m in love. My hands start to hurt when I use them too much. I had a really bad day and couldn’t even hold anything in my right hand without pain. I put the gloves on and in minutes the pain was gone. I cried, I was so happy. A life saver. Now I use them at the computer and while making jewelry. No problems anymore. They still get tired but the aching pain is all gone. Will buy again. I’m sure I’ll wear these out eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair and both are/were defective. The elastic bands on the right glove broke. I'm very disappointed that this just happened today and my deadline to return was February 2. I will never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: laurierb

customer_reviews.title: These are a God send!!!
customer_reviews.text: My hand was injured in a car accident, and being a senior have arthritis as well. With therapy and a hand brace, it's coming along. But, being a musician, it was difficult to play with the brace. Without it, my had hurt too much, so I tried these gloves and OMG, glad I did. They do help a great deal. They're very thin and allow for range of motion. The compression seems to help the pain. I don't know what the copper will do, but hey... every little bit helps. The price is right. I do recommend the gloves... I definitely feel a difference. Good purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Keytara

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The arthritis in my fingers got worse this summer, so I order Dr. Frederick's gloves, which worked very well with good compression to make the pain less. But I have heard of Copperfit and ordered it too. Disappointed is a kind phrase for these gloves. The finger sleeves are just too short, so they offer little or no relief at all. The only compression I feel from them is in the bottom of my palm, which is not arthritic. They just don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. McNaney

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gloves because my husband has arthritis in his hands - particularly his thumbs. I also bought the elbow wrap because he has a bad elbow that clicks and hurts all the time. He loves both! They help from the second he puts them on. Helps with the ache and with movement. He is able to work without pain. They are washable. he wears them everyday to work and/or when his hands are sore.
customer_reviews.author: KELLY M GRIFFIN

customer_reviews.title: Best for other body parts.
customer_reviews.text: While I must day they are effective, they are also intrusive to daily life. I immediately noticed that the gripper bars on the palm make it impossible to slide my hand down the railing on the stairs, and I cannot touch my cat without collecting large amounts of hair. I wash my hands often, so I treated the gloves with a waterproof spray, which solved that somewhat, but I still felt it necessary to remove the gloves to use the bathroom, etc, and they as re cumbersome to put on & off frequently. If I'm painting or drawing, I may use them. I have opted for magnetic bracelet instead, but I will use the kneee & foot products!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Gloves not equal quality
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could write a better review. The right glove has really nice compression, but I needed it more for my left hand than my right hand, and the left glove is super loose. I'm really very disappointed because it just doesn't give the relief that I need or that I feel it would give if it was better quality or not stretched out.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne M Fox

customer_reviews.title: Success varies
customer_reviews.text: I have the product four stars because it’s a quality made product and they seem to last as long as any others do. Eventually they get stretched and lose their effectiveness. Two members of my family have used these and had various results. Not with this particular product but with “copper compression” therapy. Does it work? Depends on who you ask. Overall this product is well made, and will likely work as well as any of its competitors. Does copper compression work? That depends entirely on your own experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Randle

customer_reviews.title: My wife, who is a Dr...and a skeptic
customer_reviews.text: told me that she was not sure if the gloves made a noticeable difference over the course of the first 2 weeks. HOWEVER, after about a month of using them only when she was working (she types A LOT), she told me that she believes that they might be making a positive difference in the reduction of discomfort that she feels in her hands, while typing. She added, that she can definitely say they don't not work. Based on that I can definitely recommend this product. Seriously, at a minimum they can be used as a possible preventative or delay having to do something medically...just sayin.
customer_reviews.author: John I. Mielke

customer_reviews.title: Work great but don't last
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a pair of these less than 6 months ago, they work great. Love them EXCEPT they have already begun to show signs of excessive ware and tear, with one section of the copper threading coming off. I really wish these lasted better as otherwise they are a great product.
customer_reviews.author: eye4bear

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I got a medium, even though I have fairly thin hands. They aren't super tight on me, but they have made my life so much better at work. I hand wind a part at an electronic components factory. I wind 5 wires 12 times around a core the size of a cheerio. Previously, I had to suffer stiffness, pain, and bloodless, cold fingers that could barely grip my wires. I can still kinda feel the pain when I flex, but these have made WORLD of difference, and have actually gotten me producing at least 20-30 more parts each day. Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Not very high quality, but the customer service people are excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I think that the compression sleeve should be thicker and more durable. The gloves are very thin and the stitching started to unravel after a few uses. The customer service was excellent, but these gloves are not something I could recommend to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: If you measure on Low end of the size, buy the next smaller one.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the size chart and my measurements fit in the Large size, but when they arrived they are too big. I wish they would be more precise on the sizes or tell people on the low end of the measurement to buy smaller. I was also disappointed that the finger coverage wasn't higher as I have issues with my knuckles and the finger coverage is too short. That was my error because the pictures did show the finger coverage wasn't was minimal. I wore them all day and all night and couldn't tell any difference, but it was worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: JRF

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality
customer_reviews.text: I expected these gloves to have a bit more 'compression' than they do. They are comfortable and easy to get on and off, however, the lettering on the back of the gloves is not screen printed so it is already peeling off after only wearing them for 3 days. Not made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very easy to sleep in which is something I was looking for. I measured my hand and ordered a size large as it suggested and it does offer nice compression. I might be able to go to a Medium instead though for just a bit more compression. I'll see if these stretch out quickly or retain their elasticity. I like the half fingers, it does not dig into your skin. Easy enough to get on and off. I would recommend them. Definitely measure your hand as suggested before ordering for the best fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Relief for Arthritis-Challenged Former Pianist!
customer_reviews.text: At 74 and with rather severe arthritis in my hands, I had hoped these gloves might enable me to play the piano again. In younger years, I played at concert-pianist level, but for past decade-plus have been unable to continue, even at a recreational level. Unfortunately these gloves were absolutely useless in relieving pain or enhancing range of motion (can't even stretch to an octave). Additionally, they were quite difficult to remove, and it was obvious the material would start to ravel in short order.
customer_reviews.author: R WARNAS

customer_reviews.title: I have these and they are not effective as another brad
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in the middle knuckle of the right hand. The fingers of these gloves are short and thus do not provide the compression needed to be effective. The left hand glove also came apart at the thumb seam the first time putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: Sitesby

customer_reviews.title: So far, incredibly impressed
customer_reviews.text: So, I didn't expect much to come of these gloves. I'm young for it, yet I have arthritis in my hands, especially at my thumb joints. The very first time I put these on, my hands stopped hurting. I wore them for hours, and felt better as time went on. Now when I wear them, it isn't immediate pain relief. And if I wear them for a few hours in the evening, or overnight while I sleep, my pain levels in the morning are nil, compared to hardly being able to move them previously. These gloves are helping a lot. Maybe they'll keep me moving until some cure is found!
customer_reviews.author: V. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: They absolutely work!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work amazing well. I have been using them for well over a year and just purchased a replacement pair. I actually have three pairs. One I use to sleep in, a second I use for various types of exercise including yoga and free weights and a third pair when I am cutting grass or doing other outside landscaping work. I am 65 and have arthritis especially in my thumb joints. These gloves provide both compression support and pain relief. They truly are amazing and I am so grateful Amazon offers them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service & gloves work well!
customer_reviews.text: My initial product arrived with a small tear, but copper compression replaced them free of charge! They work well for reducing my hand pain while crocheting. They have good grip on the palms and fingers, and are fairly comfortable. My only complaint is the looseness on my wrists and fingers vs. the relative tightness on my palms. This is probably due to the odd proportions of my hands though, as my palms are large and my fingers are kind of skinny? I don’t know. The point is, they work well for what I need them for!
customer_reviews.author: Shara B.

customer_reviews.title: Zero wrist support, barely helps anywhere else
customer_reviews.text: Provide absolutely no support to wrists and minuscule support anywhere else. Starts falling apart within the first week or two of use. First all the lettering, then the rubber stripes. Might be worth using over some other device in order to provide a better palm grip, but otherwise these are way too expensive for the quality and for their lack of well, anything to provide relief. $5, at most. They're comfortable, which is about the only good thing I can say about them.
customer_reviews.author: DAOWAce

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work.
customer_reviews.text: I've only been wearing my new copper compression gloves for 24 hours but I do see an improvement. I have Raynauds, carpal tunnel and sjogren's syndrome. My hands hurt constantly, especially when I'm on the computer. I can't even hold a coffee cup handle for very long. These gloves haven't completely eliminated the pain but make my work more bearable somewhat. I am cautiously optimistic. Definitely worth a try as they aren't particularly expensive. I may go ahead and order a second pair, one for indoor and one for outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: Tuffy

customer_reviews.title: Sizing runs small
customer_reviews.text: I am a man with medium-sized hands. I ordered the Large size, just to make sure they would be big enough. Well, they are very tight. Plus, they are difficult to remove because there's nothing to grab on to. If I grab the wrist cuff and pull the gloves off, the gloves "turn inside-out". Then, I have to turn them "right side in". Otherwise, they seem to be well made. I can't comment on pain relief because I am returning them. But, YOU might like them
customer_reviews.author: 3rdGen

customer_reviews.title: Spandex for your hands, no compression, no pain relief
customer_reviews.text: Thin material, zero compression except for the very tiny bottom ring at the wrist only because it's tight. They stretch out after one use and pretty much feel like a loose pair of bicycle shorts over your hands, the only difference between these and regular gloves is probably the spandex material. I had such high hopes that these would help the clicking I feel in my wrists when I turn my wrists and the pain with that but they did nothing. Back to the drawing board
customer_reviews.author: Tambee

customer_reviews.title: Nice, if you can get them on
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help with the arthritis in my hands and fingers. Once on, they feel good and seemed to help. I measured my hands accurately and used their chart to select a large size. However, the wrist part is long and very, very small and tight, so much so that I almost cannot get them on. It hurts my hands to put them on and take them off and negates any help they might have given me. I’m trashing them and looking for alternatives that have a more sensible and comfortable design.
customer_reviews.author: BudK

customer_reviews.title: Increases the flexibility of the hand
customer_reviews.text: Give great flexibility of the hand, which I don’t generally have. I’m not really in much pain, therefore the 4 stars on its relief. However, the range of motion is vastly improved. After three or four times of putting it on, the comfort level has risen. The glove is very tight at first, which is what I would expect. Now I can wear it most of the day to improve movement. I strongly recommend this product if you have problems with arthritis, nerve damage, or circulation
customer_reviews.author: Merry Girl

customer_reviews.title: Mom cannot fit fingers in glove.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair I bought for my mom. Used the sizing chart and bought the medium again. Mom can't even get her fingers in past the wrist opening. No size label on gloves or plastic sleeve they came in. Cannot believe that this is really a medium, must be small. I am being charged a fee to return these even though the size is wrong. NOT RIGHT!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Second time around
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought these. I simply did a reorder so I would be sure they were the same. Unfortunately they were not the same. My first pair fit perfectly. This pair was way too tight for the band around the wrist. It was so tight I finally had to cut that band off as it was cutting off the blood to my hand. Very disappointment!! as for the actual hand portion - it is great. It has removed the pain and discomfort I am still getting from my carpal tunnel surgery.
customer_reviews.author: wjw

customer_reviews.title: Not cool
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom for her arthritis, and she was very disappointed that it did nothing to ease her pain. I read the reviews and was optimistic, now I’m just embarrassed for hyping it up.
customer_reviews.author: @abadassforce

customer_reviews.title: think I like them
customer_reviews.text: I expected more compression. Originally I got the medium and thought the small would be better so I order the small also. Expected more compression but that may not be a bad thing. Gloves go on easy but are hard to get slide off from the wrist over the hand. Also would prefer if they covered the first joint. I have troubles with my thumbs and they stop just before the joint. I do think they are helping but need a bit more time with them.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Burger

customer_reviews.title: Magnet strips don't last
customer_reviews.text: Within two weeks of wearing half the magnet strips came off. I have now been wearing it 4 weeks and all the strips are gone. I still wear because the compression helps my arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Lazar

customer_reviews.title: Reduces arthritic swelling
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear when my hands swell due to arthritis. I have very small bones and these fit me, so I will recommend them to anyone else with very small hands. One time I had them on for about two hours and they started to feel a bit loose - I looked down and realized it was because the swelling in my hands had come way down! That almost never happens - if my hands swell, they stay swollen all day - so I'm happy. Planning to purchase the elbow sleeves next.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen P.

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, horrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: So I have had these gloves for barely 10 days now and they are already falling apart. I got a size medium, all gloves I wear are mediums or smalls, and they fit just like a compression item should (snug, but not so tight as to hinder circulation). It was barely a week and the gloves were already falling apart. There is a hole currently between the index and middle finger that will probably rip into one large hole for both fingers. While I love the gloves as they REALLY help with my gaming, their quality is extremely poor.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should stop selling these.
customer_reviews.text: As stated in other reviews, these gloves are very poorly made. Stitching around the cuff came apart as I put them on the first time, within 3 uses, stitching on one finger, palm and side of gloves was also unraveling. maybe these are knock offs, but if they aren't, this company should be ashamed. while I don't have joint problems in either hand, I can imagine the frustration of people who do and buy these because of the brand. Amazon should take these off the site.
customer_reviews.author: Badkity90

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Thought these would be great but totally worthless. Got the appropriate size as I have osteoarthritis. Very tight on the wrists, loosey, goosey, on the fingers, especially the thumbs which really need to be compressed. Can't really tell if the copper works or not because the gloves are too loose where they matter most and extremely uncomfortable where they should be looser. I have very small hands as well. Very strange.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great for RA in hands.
customer_reviews.text: At first these gloves were so tight I could barely get them on w/o assistance. I have Lyme disease and bad inflammation and pain in my hands. However, after wearing for a couple days and one washing(by hand) they loosened up and are much easier for me to put on. They have helped a lot with the inflammation and pain. Will be ordering another pair.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. McC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cover knuckles!
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, these seem to help reduce the arthritic pain somewhat. They are easy to put on, comfortable, and lightweight. My BIGGEST complaint about these are the fact that they DO NOT COVER THE KNUCKLES! Knuckles are where most of the Arthritic pain lives. 😕 How can you cut them off that short? Will definitely be looking for a better pair with longer finger fittings that only leave fingertips exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful.
customer_reviews.text: It was comfortable but as far as relieving the pain, it doesn’t. I am always skeptical for there is really no clear logical explanation on why a copper can relieve arthritis and pain as well as joint stiffness. But I bought it after reading the “glowing reviews.” Well in my experience it’s a waste of money, and I have a medical background. Perhaps the elasticity help a little bit, but as far as medically helping the condition, I don’t think so.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked miracles for me
customer_reviews.text: Due to circulatory issues, when sleeping the blood doesn't circulate properly through my hands. I wake up 2-4 times a night from the burning pain caused by oxygen deprivation (and I don't want to do the surgery). I've had these gloves for roughly a month and it hasn't happened once. Wearing them just at night has also helped significantly with my CT caused by excessive overuse of electronic mice. I'm buying a second pair to keep in reserve - just in case. I don't want to spend even one night without them.
customer_reviews.author: P. Neubert

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy product 'finishing' -
customer_reviews.text: Overall these compression gloves are very nice, fit well and offer good compression. My gripe is that for a company that is selling a top-tier product at a top-tier price, attention to detail and proper construction does not appear to be 'job #1'. If you look at the attached picture, you can plainly see of of the little 'strings' hanging off the finger tips where the sewing finishes up. Now, I can snip them off, and will at some point, but I feel that I shouldn't have to do this and makes me leary of the long term viability of the seems and the product actually staying sewn together.
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Please make XSmall size.
customer_reviews.text: Please make XS for women like myself with smaller hands. Small size was too large and did not provide any support or compression. I am disappointed because they seemed like just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sofie 1219

customer_reviews.title: The perfect thin lightweight gloves
customer_reviews.text: The perfect thin lightweight gloves. I use to cramp up a lot when deep sea fishing. I used these in Alaska fishing and for three day I didn't cramp up once. Not only that but a friend was starting to cramp in his left hand so I let him use the left glove and he loved it!!! Cramps stopped and we had a great week in Alaska!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Goss

product_meta.title: Copper Compression Arthritis Gloves - Guaranteed Highest Copper Content. Best Copper Glove for Carpal Tunnel, Computer Typing, and Everyday Support for Hands. Fit for Women and Men (1 Pair)

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE - In the very unlikely event that you do not absolutely Love this Copper Compression Arthritis Glove, for any reason whatsoever, we'll refund you the full price no questions asked. That's how confident we are that you'll be happy with this purchase.

HIGHEST COPPER CONTENT COMPRESSION ARTHRITIS GLOVES - Copper Compression Fingerless Arthritis Gloves are designed to help you get the support you need for all day and all night comfort. Commonly used by people suffering from pain in the hands, Arthritis, Carpal Tunnel, Tendonitis, stiff or sore muscles, tendons & joints, and more!

KEEP YOUR HANDS, FINGERS, AND WRISTS COMPRESSED with our ultra comfortable fabric that gives you support while still allowing you to retain your range of motion. This is extremely important because by retaining your range of motion, your muscles can continue to work and strengthen.
